017package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
018
019import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
020import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
021import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Frustum;
022import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException;
023import squidpony.StringKit;
024import squidpony.squidmath.HashCommon;
025import squidpony.squidmath.IntVLA;
026import squidpony.squidmath.NumberTools;
027
028import java.util.Iterator;
029import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
030
031/**
032 * An unordered map where the keys are two positive ints up to 16 bits (x and y, between 0 and 65535) and there are
033 * multiple kinds of value per key, here just a char and a float for color. Can be rendered if given a running Batch
034 * and a TextCellFactory using {@link #draw(Batch, TextCellFactory, Frustum)}.
035 * <br>
036 *
037 * @author Nathan Sweet
038 * @author Tommy Ettinger
039 */
040public class SparseTextMap implements Iterable<SparseTextMap.Entry> {
041    private static final int EMPTY = 0;
042
043    public int size;
044
045    private int[] keyTable;
046    private char[] charValueTable;
047    private float[] floatValueTable;
048    private final IntVLA keys;
049
050    private char zeroChar;
051    private float zeroFloat;
052    private boolean hasZeroValue;
053
054    private float loadFactor;
055    private int shift, mask, threshold;
056
057    private transient Entries entries1, entries2;
058    private transient CharValues charValues1, charValues2;
059    private transient FloatValues floatValues1, floatValues2;
060    private transient Keys keys1, keys2;
061
062    /**
063     * Creates a new map with an initial capacity of 192 and a load factor of 0.75.
064     */
065    public SparseTextMap() {
066        this(256, 0.75f);
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Creates a new map with a load factor of 0.75.
071     *
072     * @param initialCapacity If not a power of two, it is increased to the next nearest power of two.
073     */
074    public SparseTextMap(int initialCapacity) {
075        this(initialCapacity, 0.75f);
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * Creates a new map with the specified initial capacity and load factor. This map will hold initialCapacity items before
080     * growing the backing table.
081     *
082     * @param initialCapacity If not a power of two, it is increased to the next nearest power of two.
083     */
084    public SparseTextMap(int initialCapacity, float loadFactor) {
085        if (initialCapacity < 0)
086            throw new IllegalArgumentException("initialCapacity must be >= 0: " + initialCapacity);
087        if (loadFactor <= 0f || loadFactor >= 1f)
088            throw new IllegalArgumentException("loadFactor must be > 0 and < 1: " + loadFactor);
089        initialCapacity = HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo((int)Math.ceil(initialCapacity / loadFactor));
090        if (initialCapacity > 1 << 30)
091            throw new IllegalArgumentException("initialCapacity is too large: " + initialCapacity);
092
093        this.loadFactor = loadFactor;
094
095        threshold = (int)(initialCapacity * loadFactor);
096        mask = initialCapacity - 1;
097        shift = Long.numberOfLeadingZeros(mask);
098
099        keyTable = new int[initialCapacity];
100        charValueTable = new char[initialCapacity];
101        floatValueTable = new float[initialCapacity];
102        keys = new IntVLA(initialCapacity);
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Creates a new map identical to the specified map.
107     */
108    public SparseTextMap(SparseTextMap map) {
109        loadFactor = map.loadFactor;
110        threshold = map.threshold;
111        mask = map.mask;
112        shift = map.shift;
113        keyTable = new int[map.keyTable.length];
114        System.arraycopy(map.keyTable, 0, keyTable, 0, map.keyTable.length);
115        charValueTable = new char[map.charValueTable.length];
116        System.arraycopy(map.charValueTable, 0, charValueTable, 0, map.charValueTable.length);
117        floatValueTable = new float[map.floatValueTable.length];
118        System.arraycopy(map.floatValueTable, 0, floatValueTable, 0, map.floatValueTable.length);
119        size = map.size;
120        zeroChar = map.zeroChar;
121        zeroFloat = map.zeroFloat;
122        hasZeroValue = map.hasZeroValue;
123        keys = new IntVLA(map.keys);
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Draws the contents of this SparseTextMap, using the keys as x,y pairs as they would be entered by calling
128     * {@link #place(int, int, char, float)} and drawing the associated char at that x,y position. Uses a
129     * {@link Frustum} object, usually obtained from the current Camera with
130     * {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}, to cull anything that would be drawn out of view. Treats the
131     * float value as a color for the char, using the encoding for colors as floats that {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
132     * uses. Relies on the sizing information from the given TextCellFactory (its
133     * {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellWidth} and {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellHeight}, which may differ from its
134     * width and height if either of {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} or
135     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)} were called). It also, of course, uses the TextCellFactory to
136     * determine what its text will look like (font, size, and so on). The TextCellFactory must have been initialized,
137     * probably with {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()} after setting the width and height as desired. This method
138     * should be called between {@code batch.begin()} and {@code batch.end()} with the Batch passed to this.
139     *
140     * @param batch       the {@link FilterBatch} or other Batch used to draw this; should have already have had begin() called
141     * @param textFactory used to determine the font, size, cell size, and other information; must be initialized
142     */
143    public void draw(Batch batch, TextCellFactory textFactory) {
144        draw(batch, textFactory, 0f, 0f);
145    }
146    /**
147     * Draws the contents of this SparseTextMap, using the keys as x,y pairs as they would be entered by calling
148     * {@link #place(int, int, char, float)} and drawing the associated char at that x,y position, potentially with an
149     * offset on x and/or y. Uses a {@link Frustum} object, usually obtained from the current Camera with
150     * {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}, to cull anything that would be drawn out of view. Treats the
151     * float value as a color for the char, using the encoding for colors as floats that {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
152     * uses. Relies on the sizing information from the given TextCellFactory (its
153     * {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellWidth} and {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellHeight}, which may differ from its
154     * width and height if either of {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} or
155     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)} were called). It also, of course, uses the TextCellFactory to
156     * determine what its text will look like (font, size, and so on). The TextCellFactory must have been initialized,
157     * probably with {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()} after setting the width and height as desired. This method
158     * should be called between {@code batch.begin()} and {@code batch.end()} with the Batch passed to this.
159     *
160     * @param batch       the {@link FilterBatch} or other Batch used to draw this; should have already have had begin() called
161     * @param textFactory used to determine the font, size, cell size, and other information; must be initialized
162     * @param screenOffsetX offset to apply to the x position of each char rendered; positive moves chars right
163     * @param screenOffsetY offset to apply to the y position of each char rendered; positive moves chars up
164     */
165    public void draw(Batch batch, TextCellFactory textFactory, float screenOffsetX, float screenOffsetY) {
166        //textFactory.configureShader(batch);
167        final float widthInc = textFactory.actualCellWidth, heightInc = -textFactory.actualCellHeight;
168        int n;
169        for (Entry entry : entries()) {
170            n = entry.key;
171//            n ^= n >>> 16;
172//            n *= 0xA123B;
173
174//            n ^= n << 26;
175//            n ^= n >>> 15;
176//            n ^= n << 17;
177            textFactory.draw(batch, entry.charValue, entry.floatValue,
178                    (n & 0xFFFF) * widthInc + screenOffsetX, (n >>> 16) * heightInc + screenOffsetY);
179        }
180    }
181    /**
182     * Draws the contents of this SparseTextMap, using the keys as x,y pairs as they would be entered by calling
183     * {@link #place(int, int, char, float)} and drawing the associated char at that x,y position. Uses a
184     * {@link Frustum} object, usually obtained from the current Camera with
185     * {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}, to cull anything that would be drawn out of view. Treats the
186     * float value as a color for the char, using the encoding for colors as floats that {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
187     * uses. Relies on the sizing information from the given TextCellFactory (its
188     * {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellWidth} and {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellHeight}, which may differ from its
189     * width and height if either of {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} or
190     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)} were called). It also, of course, uses the TextCellFactory to
191     * determine what its text will look like (font, size, and so on). The TextCellFactory must have been initialized,
192     * probably with {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()} after setting the width and height as desired. This method
193     * should be called between {@code batch.begin()} and {@code batch.end()} with the Batch passed to this.
194     *
195     * @param batch       the {@link FilterBatch} or other Batch used to draw this; should have already have had begin() called
196     * @param textFactory used to determine the font, size, cell size, and other information; must be initialized
197     * @param frustum     a {@link Frustum} object to determine culling, almost always obtained from {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}
198     */
199    public void draw(Batch batch, TextCellFactory textFactory, Frustum frustum) {
200        draw(batch, textFactory, frustum, 0f, 0f);
201    }
202    /**
203     * Draws the contents of this SparseTextMap, using the keys as x,y pairs as they would be entered by calling
204     * {@link #place(int, int, char, float)} and drawing the associated char at that x,y position, potentially with an
205     * offset on x and/or y. Uses a {@link Frustum} object, usually obtained from the current Camera with
206     * {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}, to cull anything that would be drawn out of view. Treats the
207     * float value as a color for the char, using the encoding for colors as floats that {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
208     * uses. Relies on the sizing information from the given TextCellFactory (its
209     * {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellWidth} and {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellHeight}, which may differ from its
210     * width and height if either of {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} or
211     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)} were called). It also, of course, uses the TextCellFactory to
212     * determine what its text will look like (font, size, and so on). The TextCellFactory must have been initialized,
213     * probably with {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()} after setting the width and height as desired. This method
214     * should be called between {@code batch.begin()} and {@code batch.end()} with the Batch passed to this.
215     *
216     * @param batch       the {@link FilterBatch} or other Batch used to draw this; should have already have had begin() called
217     * @param textFactory used to determine the font, size, cell size, and other information; must be initialized
218     * @param frustum     a {@link Frustum} object to determine culling, almost always obtained from {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}
219     * @param screenOffsetX offset to apply to the x position of each char rendered; positive moves chars right
220     * @param screenOffsetY offset to apply to the y position of each char rendered; positive moves chars up
221     */
222    public void draw(Batch batch, TextCellFactory textFactory, Frustum frustum, float screenOffsetX, float screenOffsetY) {
223        //textFactory.configureShader(batch);
224        final float widthInc = textFactory.actualCellWidth, heightInc = -textFactory.actualCellHeight;
225        float x, y;
226        int n;
227        for (Entry entry : entries()) {
228            n = entry.key;
229//            n ^= n >>> 16;
230//            n *= 0xA123B;
231
232//            n ^= n << 26;
233//            n ^= n >>> 15;
234//            n ^= n << 17;
235            x = (n & 0xFFFF) * widthInc + screenOffsetX;
236            y = (n >>> 16) * heightInc + screenOffsetY;
237            if(frustum.boundsInFrustum(x, y, 0f, widthInc, -heightInc, 0f))
238                textFactory.draw(batch, entry.charValue, entry.floatValue, x, y);
239        }
240    }
241
242    /**
243     * Draws the contents of this SparseTextMap, using the keys as x,y pairs as they would be entered by calling
244     * {@link #place(int, int, char, float)} and drawing the char replacement at that x,y position, potentially with an
245     * offset on x and/or y. Uses a {@link Frustum} object, usually obtained from the current Camera with
246     * {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}, to cull anything that would be drawn out of view. Treats the
247     * float value as a color for replacement, using the encoding for colors as floats that {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
248     * uses. Relies on the sizing information from the given TextCellFactory (its
249     * {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellWidth} and {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellHeight}, which may differ from its
250     * width and height if either of {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} or
251     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)} were called). It also, of course, uses the TextCellFactory to
252     * determine what its text will look like (font, size, and so on). The TextCellFactory must have been initialized,
253     * probably with {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()} after setting the width and height as desired. This method
254     * should be called between {@code batch.begin()} and {@code batch.end()} with the Batch passed to this.
255     *
256     * @param batch       the {@link FilterBatch} or other Batch used to draw this; should have already have had begin() called
257     * @param textFactory used to determine the font, size, cell size, and other information; must be initialized
258     * @param frustum     a {@link Frustum} object to determine culling, almost always obtained from {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}
259     * @param screenOffsetX offset to apply to the x position of each char rendered; positive moves chars right
260     * @param screenOffsetY offset to apply to the y position of each char rendered; positive moves chars up
261     * @param replacement a char that will be used in place of the normal char values stored in this; often the char
262     *                    with Unicode value 0, which renders as a solid block.
263     */
264    public void draw(Batch batch, TextCellFactory textFactory, Frustum frustum, float screenOffsetX, float screenOffsetY, char replacement) {
265        //textFactory.configureShader(batch);
266        final float widthInc = textFactory.actualCellWidth, heightInc = -textFactory.actualCellHeight;
267        float x, y;
268        int n;
269        for (Entry entry : entries()) {
270            n = entry.key;
271//            n ^= n >>> 16;
272//            n *= 0xA123B;
273
274//            n ^= n << 26;
275//            n ^= n >>> 15;
276//            n ^= n << 17;
277//            n =    ((n & 0x22222222) << 1) | ((n >>> 1) & 0x22222222) | (n & 0x99999999);
278//            n =    ((n & 0x0c0c0c0c) << 2) | ((n >>> 2) & 0x0c0c0c0c) | (n & 0xc3c3c3c3);
279//            n =    ((n & 0x00f000f0) << 4) | ((n >>> 4) & 0x00f000f0) | (n & 0xf00ff00f);
280//            n =    ((n & 0x0000ff00) << 8) | ((n >>> 8) & 0x0000ff00) | (n & 0xff0000ff);
281            x = (n & 0xFFFF) * widthInc + screenOffsetX;
282            y = (n >>> 16) * heightInc + screenOffsetY;
283            if(frustum.boundsInFrustum(x, y, 0f, widthInc, -heightInc, 0f)) 
284                textFactory.draw(batch, replacement, entry.floatValue, x, y);
285        }
286    }
287
288    /**
289     * Packs the given x,y position into one int in the type that is used elsewhere in this class.
290     * This requires x and y to each be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive.
291     *
292     * @param x the x component to encode; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
293     * @param y the y component to encode; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
294     * @return an encoded form of the x,y pair in the style used elsewhere in this class
295     */
296    public static int encodePosition(final int x, final int y) {
297        return (x | y << 16);
298//        final int n = (x | y << 16) * 0x4F6F3;
299//        return n ^ n >>> 16;
300
301//        n ^= n << 17;
302//        n ^= n >>> 15;
303//        n ^= n >>> 30;
304//        return n ^ n << 26;
305        //return GreasedRegion.interleaveBits(x, y);
306    }
307
308    /**
309     * Decodes a packed position and gets the x component from it, if it was produced by
310     * {@link #encodePosition(int, int)} or {@link #place(int, int, char, float)}.
311     *
312     * @param encoded a packed position that holds x and y components
313     * @return the x component packed in the parameter
314     */
315    public static int decodeX(final int encoded) {
316        return encoded & 0xFFFF;
317//        return ((encoded ^ encoded >>> 16) * 0xA123B) & 0xFFFF;
318//        encoded ^= encoded << 26;
319//        return (encoded ^ encoded >>> 15) & 0xFFFF;
320        //return GreasedRegion.disperseBits(encoded) & 0xFFFF;
321    }
322
323    /**
324     * Decodes a packed position and gets the y component from it, if it was produced by
325     * {@link #encodePosition(int, int)} or {@link #place(int, int, char, float)}.
326     *
327     * @param encoded a packed position that holds x and y components
328     * @return the y component packed in the parameter
329     */
330    public static int decodeY(final int encoded) {
331        return encoded >>> 16;
332//        return ((encoded ^ encoded >>> 16) * 0xA123B) >>> 16;
333//        encoded ^= encoded << 26;
334//        encoded ^= encoded >>> 15;
335//        return (encoded ^ encoded << 17) >>> 16;
336        //return GreasedRegion.disperseBits(encoded) >>> 16;
337    }
338
339    private int fibonacci(final int item) {
340        // shift is always greater than 32, less than 64
341        return (int)(item * 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L >>> shift);
342    }
343
344    private int locateKey (final int key) {
345        return locateKey(key, fibonacci(key));
346    }
347
348    /**
349     * Given a key and its initial placement to try in an array, this finds the actual location of the key in the array
350     * if it is present, or -1 if the key is not present. This can be overridden if a subclass needs to compare for
351     * equality differently than just by using == with int keys, but only within the same package.
352     *
353     * @param key       a K key that will be checked for equality if a similar-seeming key is found
354     * @param placement as calculated by {@link #fibonacci(int)}, almost always with {@code place(key)}
355     * @return the location in the key array of key, if found, or -1 if it was not found.
356     */
357    private int locateKey (final int key, final int placement) {
358        for (int i = placement; ; i = i + 1 & mask) {
359            // empty space is available
360            if (keyTable[i] == 0) {
361                return -1;
362            }
363            if (key == (keyTable[i])) {
364                return i;
365            }
366        }
367    }
368
369
370    /**
371     * Places a char in the given libGDX Color at the requested x, y position in grid cells, where x and y must each be
372     * between 0 and 65535, both inclusive. The color can also be an SColor, such as one of the many constants in that
373     * class. Returns the int code that can be used to locate the x,y pair as a key in this SparseTextMap.
374     *
375     * @param x         the x position of the colorful char; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
376     * @param y         the y position of the colorful char; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
377     * @param charValue the char to put into the SparseTextMap
378     * @param color     the libGDX Color or SColor to use for the char
379     * @return the int that the x,y pair will be stored at, and used as the single key associated with the colorful char
380     */
381    public int place(int x, int y, char charValue, Color color) {
382        return place(x, y, charValue, color.toFloatBits());
383    }
384
385    /**
386     * Places a char in the given encoded color at the requested x, y position in grid cells, where x and y must each be
387     * between 0 and 65535, both inclusive, and the encoded color is one produced by {@link Color#toFloatBits()} or any
388     * of several methods in {@link SColor}, such as {@link SColor#floatGetI(int, int, int)},
389     * {@link SColor#floatGetHSV(float, float, float, float)}, or {@link SColor#lerpFloatColors(float, float, float)}.
390     * Returns the int code that can be used to locate the x,y pair as a key in this SparseTextMap.
391     *
392     * @param x            the x position of the colorful char; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
393     * @param y            the y position of the colorful char; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
394     * @param charValue    the char to put into the SparseTextMap
395     * @param encodedColor the encoded color to use for the char, as produced by {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
396     * @return the int that the x,y pair will be stored at, and used as the single key associated with the colorful char
397     */
398    public int place(int x, int y, char charValue, float encodedColor) {
399        int code = encodePosition(x, y);
400        put(code, charValue, encodedColor);
401        return code;
402    }
403
404    public void put (int key, char charValue, float floatValue) {
405        if (key == 0) {
406            zeroChar = charValue;
407            zeroFloat = floatValue;
408            if (!hasZeroValue) {
409                hasZeroValue = true;
410                keys.add(0);
411                size++;
412            }
413            return;
414        }
415
416        int b = fibonacci(key);
417        int loc = locateKey(key, b);
418        // an identical key already exists
419        if (loc != -1) {
420            charValueTable[loc] = charValue;
421            floatValueTable[loc] = floatValue;
422            return;
423        }
424        final int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
425        final char[] charValueTable = this.charValueTable;
426        final float[] floatValueTable = this.floatValueTable;
427        keys.add(key);
428
429        for (int i = b; ; i = (i + 1) & mask) {
430            // space is available so we insert and break
431            if (keyTable[i] == 0) {
432                keyTable[i] = key;
433                charValueTable[i] = charValue;
434                floatValueTable[i] = floatValue;
435                
436                if (++size >= threshold) {
437                    resize(keyTable.length << 1);
438                }
439                return;
440            }
441        }
442    }
443    
444    /**
445     * If and only if key is already present, this changes the float associated with it while leaving the char the same.
446     * @param key the encoded key as produced by {@link #encodePosition(int, int)}
447     * @param floatValue
448     */
449    public void updateFloat(int key, float floatValue)
450    {
451        if (key == 0 && hasZeroValue) {
452            //zeroChar = charValue;
453            zeroFloat = floatValue;
454            return;
455        }
456        
457        int loc = locateKey(key);
458        // an identical key already exists
459        if (loc != -1) {
460//            charValueTable[loc] = charValue;
461            floatValueTable[loc] = floatValue;
462        }
463    }
464
465    public void updateChar(int key, char charValue)
466    {
467        if (key == 0 && hasZeroValue) {
468            zeroChar = charValue;
469            //zeroFloat = floatValue;
470            return;
471        }
472
473        int loc = locateKey(key);
474        // an identical key already exists
475        if (loc != -1) {
476            charValueTable[loc] = charValue;
477//            floatValueTable[loc] = floatValue;
478        }
479    }
480
481    public void putAll(SparseTextMap map) {
482        ensureCapacity(map.size);
483        final int[] keys = map.keys.items;
484        final char[] chars = map.charValueTable;
485        final float[] floats = map.floatValueTable;
486        int k, loc;
487        for (int i = 0, n = map.keys.size; i < n; i++) {
488            k = keys[i];
489            loc = map.locateKey(k);
490            put(k, chars[loc], floats[loc]);
491        }
492
493//        ensureCapacity(map.size);
494//        if (map.hasZeroValue)
495//            put(0, map.zeroChar, map.zeroFloat);
496//        final int[] keyTable = map.keyTable;
497//        final char[] charValueTable = map.charValueTable;
498//        final float[] floatValueTable = map.floatValueTable;
499//        int k;
500//        for (int i = 0, n = keyTable.length; i < n; i++) {
501//            if ((k = keyTable[i]) != 0)
502//                put(k, charValueTable[i], floatValueTable[i]);
503//        }
504
505//        for (Entry entry : map.entries())
506//            put(entry.key, entry.charValue, entry.floatValue);
507    }
508
509    /**
510     * Skips checks for existing keys.
511     */
512    private void putResize(int key, char charValue, float floatValue) {
513        if (key == 0) {
514            zeroChar = charValue;
515            zeroFloat = floatValue;
516            if (!hasZeroValue) {
517                hasZeroValue = true;
518                size++;
519            }
520            return;
521        }
522
523        int b = fibonacci(key);
524        final int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
525        final char[] charValueTable = this.charValueTable;
526        final float[] floatValueTable = this.floatValueTable;
527
528        for (int i = b; ; i = (i + 1) & mask) {
529            // space is available so we insert and break
530            if (keyTable[i] == 0) {
531                keyTable[i] = key;
532                charValueTable[i] = charValue;
533                floatValueTable[i] = floatValue;
534 
535                if (++size >= threshold) {
536                    resize(keyTable.length << 1);
537                }
538                return;
539            }
540        }
541    }
542
543    /**
544     * @param x the x-component of the position to look up 
545     * @param y the y-component of the position to look up
546     * @param defaultValue Returned if the key was not associated with a value.
547     * @return the char associated with the given position, or defaultValue if no char is associated
548     */
549    public char getChar(int x, int y, char defaultValue) {
550        return getChar(encodePosition(x, y), defaultValue);
551    }
552
553    /**
554     * @param key the encoded key as produced by {@link #encodePosition(int, int)}
555     * @param defaultValue Returned if the key was not associated with a value.
556     * @return the char associated with the given key, or defaultValue if no char is associated
557     */
558    public char getChar(int key, char defaultValue) {
559        if (key == 0) {
560            if (!hasZeroValue) return defaultValue;
561            return zeroChar;
562        }
563        final int placement = fibonacci(key);
564        for (int i = placement; ; i = i + 1 & mask) {
565            // empty space is available
566            if (keyTable[i] == 0) {
567                return defaultValue;
568            }
569            if (key == (keyTable[i])) {
570                return charValueTable[i];
571            }
572        }
573    }
574
575    /**
576     * @param x the x-component of the position to look up 
577     * @param y the y-component of the position to look up
578     * @param defaultValue Returned if the key was not associated with a value.
579     * @return the float associated with the given position, or defaultValue if no float is associated
580     */
581    public float getFloat(int x, int y, float defaultValue) {
582        return getFloat(encodePosition(x, y), defaultValue);
583    }
584
585    /**
586     * @param key the encoded key as produced by {@link #encodePosition(int, int)}
587     * @param defaultValue Returned if the key was not associated with a value.
588     * @return the float associated with the given key, or defaultValue if no float is associated
589     */
590    public float getFloat(int key, float defaultValue) {
591        if (key == 0) {
592            if (!hasZeroValue) return defaultValue;
593            return zeroFloat;
594        }
595        final int placement = fibonacci(key);
596        for (int i = placement; ; i = i + 1 & mask) {
597            // empty space is available
598            if (keyTable[i] == 0) {
599                return defaultValue;
600            }
601            if (key == (keyTable[i])) {
602                return floatValueTable[i];
603            }
604        }
605    }
606
607    public void remove(int key) {
608        remove(key, '#');
609    }
610
611    public char remove(int key, char defaultValue) {
612        if (key == 0) {
613            if (!hasZeroValue) return defaultValue;
614            hasZeroValue = false;
615            size--;
616            keys.removeValue(0);
617            return zeroChar;
618        }
619
620        int loc = locateKey(key);
621        if (loc == -1) {
622            return defaultValue;
623        }
624        keys.removeValue(key);
625        final int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
626        final float[] floatValueTable = this.floatValueTable;
627        final char[] charValueTable = this.charValueTable;
628        char oldChar = charValueTable[loc];
629        int next = loc + 1 & mask;
630        int placement;
631        while ((key = keyTable[next]) != 0) {
632            placement = fibonacci(key);
633            if((next - placement & mask) > (loc - placement & mask)) {
634                keyTable[loc] = key;
635                floatValueTable[loc] = floatValueTable[next];
636                charValueTable[loc] = charValueTable[next];
637                loc = next;
638            }
639            next = next + 1 & mask;
640        }
641        keyTable[loc] = 0;
642        --size;
643        return oldChar;
644    }
645
646    /**
647     * Reduces the size of the backing arrays to be the specified capacity or less. If the capacity is already less, nothing is
648     * done. If the map contains more items than the specified capacity, the next highest power of two capacity is used instead.
649     */
650    public void shrink(int maximumCapacity) {
651        if (maximumCapacity < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("maximumCapacity must be >= 0: " + maximumCapacity);
652        if (size > maximumCapacity) maximumCapacity = size;
653        if (keyTable.length <= maximumCapacity) return;
654        resize(HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo(maximumCapacity));
655    }
656
657    /**
658     * Clears the map and reduces the size of the backing arrays to be the specified capacity if they are larger.
659     */
660    public void clear(int maximumCapacity) {
661        if (keyTable.length <= maximumCapacity) {
662            clear();
663            return;
664        }
665        hasZeroValue = false;
666        size = 0;
667        keys.clear();
668        resize(maximumCapacity);
669    }
670
671    public void clear() {
672        if (size == 0) return;
673        keys.clear();
674        final int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
675        for (int i = keyTable.length; i > 0; ) {
676            keyTable[--i] = 0;
677        }
678        size = 0;
679        hasZeroValue = false;
680    }
681
682    /**
683     * Returns true if the specified char value is in the map. Note: this traverses the entire map and compares every
684     * value, which may be an expensive operation.
685     */
686    public boolean containsCharValue(char value) {
687        if (hasZeroValue && zeroChar == value) return true;
688        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
689        char[] valueTable = this.charValueTable;
690        for (int i = keyTable.length; i-- > 0; )
691            if (keyTable[i] != 0 && valueTable[i] == value) return true;
692        return false;
693    }
694
695    /**
696     * Returns true if the specified char value is in the map. Note: this traverses the entire map and compares every
697     * value, which may be an expensive operation.
698     */
699    public boolean containsFloatValue(float value) {
700        if (hasZeroValue && zeroFloat == value) return true;
701        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
702        float[] valueTable = this.floatValueTable;
703        for (int i = keyTable.length; i-- > 0; )
704            if (keyTable[i] != 0 && valueTable[i] == value) return true;
705        return false;
706    }
707
708    public boolean containsKey(int key) {
709        if (key == 0) return hasZeroValue;
710        return locateKey(key) != -1;
711    }
712
713    /**
714     * Returns the key for the specified char value, or notFound if it is not in the map. Note this traverses the
715     * entire map and compares every value, which may be an expensive operation.
716     */
717    public int findKey(char value, int notFound) {
718        if (hasZeroValue && zeroChar == value) return 0;
719        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
720        char[] valueTable = this.charValueTable;
721        for (int i = keyTable.length; i-- > 0; )
722            if (keyTable[i] != 0 && valueTable[i] == value) return keyTable[i];
723        return notFound;
724    }
725
726    /**
727     * Returns the key for the specified float value, or notFound if it is not in the map. Note this traverses the
728     * entire map and compares every value, which may be an expensive operation.
729     */
730    public int findKey(float value, int notFound) {
731        if (hasZeroValue && zeroFloat == value) return 0;
732        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
733        float[] valueTable = this.floatValueTable;
734        for (int i = keyTable.length; i-- > 0; )
735            if (keyTable[i] != 0 && valueTable[i] == value) return keyTable[i];
736        return notFound;
737    }
738
739    /**
740     * Increases the size of the backing array to accommodate the specified number of additional items. Useful before adding many
741     * items to avoid multiple backing array resizes.
742     */
743    public void ensureCapacity(int additionalCapacity) {
744        if (additionalCapacity < 0)
745            throw new IllegalArgumentException("additionalCapacity must be >= 0: " + additionalCapacity);
746        int sizeNeeded = size + additionalCapacity;
747        keys.ensureCapacity(additionalCapacity);
748        if (sizeNeeded >= threshold)
749            resize(HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo((int)Math.ceil(sizeNeeded / loadFactor)));
750    }
751
752    private void resize(int newSize) {
753        int oldCapacity = keyTable.length;
754        threshold = (int)(newSize * loadFactor);
755        mask = newSize - 1;
756        shift = Long.numberOfLeadingZeros(mask);
757
758        final int[] oldKeyTable = keyTable;
759        final float[] oldFloats = floatValueTable;
760        final char[] oldChars = charValueTable;
761
762        keyTable = new int[newSize];
763        floatValueTable = new float[newSize];
764        charValueTable = new char[newSize];
765
766        int oldSize = size;
767        size = 0;
768        hasZeroValue = false;
769        if (oldSize > 0) {
770            for (int i = 0; i < oldCapacity; i++) {
771                int key = oldKeyTable[i];
772                if (key != 0)
773                    putResize(key, oldChars[i], oldFloats[i]);
774            }
775        }
776    }
777
778    public int hashCode() {
779        int h = 0;
780        if (hasZeroValue) {
781            h = NumberTools.floatToIntBits(zeroFloat) ^ zeroChar;
782        }
783        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
784        char[] charTable = this.charValueTable;
785        float[] floatTable = this.floatValueTable;
786        for (int i = 0, n = keyTable.length; i < n; i++) {
787            int key = keyTable[i];
788            if (key != EMPTY) {
789                h += key ^ NumberTools.floatToIntBits(floatTable[i]);
790                h ^= charTable[i];
791            }
792        }
793        return h;
794    }
795
796    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
797        if (obj == this) return true;
798        if (!(obj instanceof SparseTextMap)) return false;
799        SparseTextMap other = (SparseTextMap) obj;
800        if (other.size != size) return false;
801        if (other.hasZeroValue != hasZeroValue) return false;
802        if (hasZeroValue && (other.zeroChar != zeroChar || other.zeroFloat != zeroFloat)) {
803            return false;
804        }
805        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
806        char[] charTable = this.charValueTable;
807        float[] floatTable = this.floatValueTable;
808        for (int i = 0, n = keyTable.length; i < n; i++) {
809            int key = keyTable[i];
810            if (key != EMPTY) {
811                char otherValue = other.getChar(key, '\0');
812                if (otherValue == 0 && !other.containsKey(key) 
813                        || otherValue != charTable[i]
814                        || other.getFloat(key, Float.NaN) != floatTable[i]) return false;
815            }
816        }
817        return true;
818    }
819
820    public String toString() {
821        if (size == 0) return "{}";
822        StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder(32);
823        buffer.append('{');
824        int[] keys = this.keys.items;
825        char[] charTable = this.charValueTable;
826        float[] floatTable = this.floatValueTable;
827        int n = size, loc, k = keys[0];
828        if(k == 0)
829            StringKit.appendHex(buffer.append("0=").append(zeroChar).append(','), zeroFloat);
830        else
831        {
832            loc = locateKey(k);
833            StringKit.appendHex(buffer.append(k).append('=').append(charTable[loc]).append(','), floatTable[loc]);
834        }
835
836        for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
837            buffer.append("; ");
838            k = keys[i];
839            if(k == 0)
840                StringKit.appendHex(buffer.append("0=").append(zeroChar).append(','), zeroFloat);
841            else 
842            {
843                loc = locateKey(k);
844                StringKit.appendHex(buffer.append(k).append('=').append(charTable[loc]).append(','), floatTable[loc]);
845            }
846        }
847        buffer.append('}');
848        return buffer.toString();
849    }
850
851    public Iterator<Entry> iterator() {
852        return entries();
853    }
854
855    /**
856     * Returns an iterator for the entries in the map. Remove is supported. Note that the same iterator instance is returned each
857     * time this method is called. Use the {@link Entries} constructor for nested or multithreaded iteration.
858     */
859    public Entries entries() {
860        if (entries1 == null) {
861            entries1 = new Entries(this);
862            entries2 = new Entries(this);
863        }
864        if (!entries1.valid) {
865            entries1.reset();
866            entries1.valid = true;
867            entries2.valid = false;
868            return entries1;
869        }
870        entries2.reset();
871        entries2.valid = true;
872        entries1.valid = false;
873        return entries2;
874    }
875
876    /**
877     * Returns an iterator for the values in the map. Remove is supported. Note that the same iterator instance is returned each
878     * time this method is called. Use the {@link Entries} constructor for nested or multithreaded iteration.
879     */
880    public CharValues charValues() {
881        if (charValues1 == null) {
882            charValues1 = new CharValues(this);
883            charValues2 = new CharValues(this);
884        }
885        if (!charValues1.valid) {
886            charValues1.reset();
887            charValues1.valid = true;
888            charValues2.valid = false;
889            return charValues1;
890        }
891        charValues2.reset();
892        charValues2.valid = true;
893        charValues1.valid = false;
894        return charValues2;
895    }
896
897    /**
898     * Returns an iterator for the values in the map. Remove is supported. Note that the same iterator instance is returned each
899     * time this method is called. Use the {@link Entries} constructor for nested or multithreaded iteration.
900     */
901    public FloatValues floatValues() {
902        if (floatValues1 == null) {
903            floatValues1 = new FloatValues(this);
904            floatValues2 = new FloatValues(this);
905        }
906        if (!floatValues1.valid) {
907            floatValues1.reset();
908            floatValues1.valid = true;
909            floatValues2.valid = false;
910            return floatValues1;
911        }
912        floatValues2.reset();
913        floatValues2.valid = true;
914        floatValues1.valid = false;
915        return floatValues2;
916    }
917
918    /**
919     * Returns an iterator for the keys in the map. Remove is supported. Note that the same iterator instance is returned each time
920     * this method is called. Use the {@link Entries} constructor for nested or multithreaded iteration.
921     */
922    public Keys keys() {
923        if (keys1 == null) {
924            keys1 = new Keys(this);
925            keys2 = new Keys(this);
926        }
927        if (!keys1.valid) {
928            keys1.reset();
929            keys1.valid = true;
930            keys2.valid = false;
931            return keys1;
932        }
933        keys2.reset();
934        keys2.valid = true;
935        keys1.valid = false;
936        return keys2;
937    }
938
939    static public class Entry {
940        public int key;
941        public char charValue;
942        public float floatValue;
943
944        public String toString() {
945            return key + "=" + charValue + "," + floatValue;
946        }
947    }
948
949    static private class MapIterator {
950        static final int INDEX_ILLEGAL = -2;
951        static final int INDEX_ZERO = -1;
952
953        public boolean hasNext;
954
955        final SparseTextMap map;
956        final IntVLA keys;
957        int nextIndex, currentIndex;
958        boolean valid = true;
959
960        public MapIterator(SparseTextMap map) {
961            this.map = map;
962            this.keys = map.keys;
963            reset();
964        }
965
966        public void reset() {
967            currentIndex = -1;
968            nextIndex = 0;
969            hasNext = map.size > 0;
970        }
971    }
972
973    static public class Entries extends MapIterator implements Iterable<Entry>, Iterator<Entry> {
974        private Entry entry = new Entry();
975
976        public Entries(SparseTextMap map) {
977            super(map);
978        }
979
980        /**
981         * Note the same entry instance is returned each time this method is called.
982         */
983        public Entry next() {
984            if (!hasNext) throw new NoSuchElementException();
985            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
986            currentIndex = nextIndex;
987            entry.key = keys.get(nextIndex);
988            if(entry.key == 0)
989            {
990                entry.charValue = map.zeroChar;
991                entry.floatValue = map.zeroFloat;
992            }
993            else {
994                int loc = map.locateKey(entry.key);
995                entry.charValue = map.charValueTable[loc];
996                entry.floatValue = map.floatValueTable[loc];
997            }
998            nextIndex++;
999            hasNext = nextIndex < map.size;
1000            return entry;
1001        }
1002
1003        public boolean hasNext() {
1004            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1005            return hasNext;
1006        }
1007
1008        public Iterator<Entry> iterator() {
1009            return this;
1010        }
1011
1012        public void remove () {
1013            if (currentIndex < 0)
1014                throw new IllegalStateException("next must be called before remove.");
1015            map.remove(entry.key);
1016            nextIndex--;
1017            currentIndex = -1;
1018        }
1019    }
1020
1021    static public class CharValues extends MapIterator {
1022        public CharValues(SparseTextMap map) {
1023            super(map);
1024        }
1025
1026        public boolean hasNext() {
1027            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1028            return hasNext;
1029        }
1030
1031        public char next() {
1032            if (!hasNext) throw new NoSuchElementException();
1033            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1034            char value = map.getChar(keys.get(nextIndex), '\0');
1035            currentIndex = nextIndex;
1036            nextIndex++;
1037            hasNext = nextIndex < map.size;
1038            return value;
1039        }
1040
1041        /**
1042         * Returns a new array containing the remaining values.
1043         */
1044        public char[] toArray() {
1045            char[] array = new char[map.size - nextIndex];
1046            int idx = 0;
1047            while (hasNext && idx < array.length)
1048                array[idx++] = next();
1049            return array;
1050        }
1051    }
1052
1053    static public class FloatValues extends MapIterator {
1054        public FloatValues(SparseTextMap map) {
1055            super(map);
1056        }
1057
1058        public boolean hasNext() {
1059            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1060            return hasNext;
1061        }
1062
1063        public float next() {
1064            if (!hasNext) throw new NoSuchElementException();
1065            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1066            float value = map.getFloat(keys.get(nextIndex), '\0');
1067            currentIndex = nextIndex;
1068            nextIndex++;
1069            hasNext = nextIndex < map.size;
1070            return value;
1071        }
1072
1073        /**
1074         * Returns a new array containing the remaining values.
1075         */
1076        public float[] toArray() {
1077            float[] array = new float[map.size - nextIndex];
1078            int idx = 0;
1079            while (hasNext && idx < array.length)
1080                array[idx++] = next();
1081            return array;
1082        }
1083    }
1084
1085    static public class Keys extends MapIterator {
1086        public Keys(SparseTextMap map) {
1087            super(map);
1088        }
1089
1090        public boolean hasNext() {
1091            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1092            return hasNext;
1093        }
1094
1095        public int next() {
1096            if (!hasNext) throw new NoSuchElementException();
1097            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1098            int key = keys.get(nextIndex);
1099            currentIndex = nextIndex;
1100            nextIndex++;
1101            hasNext = nextIndex < map.size;
1102            return key;
1103        }
1104
1105        /**
1106         * Returns a new array containing the remaining keys.
1107         */
1108        public int[] toArray() {
1109            int[] array = new int[map.size - nextIndex];
1110            int idx = 0;
1111            while (hasNext && idx < array.length)
1112                array[idx++] = next();
1113            return array;
1114        }
1115    }
1116}
